result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Keshari D Gordon
Current: 2501 19th St. Apt. 12, Racine, WI 53403 United States  (Effective: 10-28-2022)
Prior: 709 Seventeenth St, Racine, WI 53403

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: ***ALSO $5,000.00 CO-SIGNATURE BOND BY DEFENDANT'S FATHER BRIAN GRANDBERRY.*** Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

9:10 AM Defendant Keshari D Gordon in court.  Attorney Carl Johnson for Patrick Kiernan Cafferty in court for Keshari D Gordon.  Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Defense states investigation is yet being completed as to one of the substances.
Defense moves to modify bond to $5,000 cash, same conditions.
State requests to have a $5,000 cash and $5,000 signature component.
BTC: Bond modified to $5,000 cash and $5,000 co-signature by defendant's father, Brian Grandberry.
Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on January 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.
